text:
Poured from a 750 ml bottle. 
Aroma is fruity with some acidity. Some citrus notes with golden raisins, green grapes, tropical fruit, pineapple and melon. Some light oak and tannins. Light phenolics with some light ethyl acetate notes. Some floral and herbal notes as well. 
Pours a slightly hazy copper color with a small, thin, white head that recedes quickly to the edges where it lingers for a little bit before disappearing. No lacing or legs. 
Flavor is fairly acidic with a light sharpness to it and a hint of sweetness. Lots of citrus and pineapple in the acidity. Some green grape, golden raisin and unripe tropical fruit and melon notes. Light herbal notes with hints of oak and tannins. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium low carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, an alright beer. The acidity is too strong and kind of overwhelms the herbal notes of the gruit. The barrel character is fairly well balanced though. I just wish the acidity was dialed back by about 50%.

[ bottle ][ 1oz ][ @tasting ][ $ ? ][ snifter ][ 11.14.15 ]hazy pink-gold, thin white ring. Plastic chlorine nose, light green vegetal celery, slight berry pith. Way better profile, lightly buteric, high acid Berry front palate, sparkling and inoffensive, bit of plastic and slick across mid, light grape skin into the sugary finish, citric acid tingling jowls.

750ml bottle at the November 2015 DC Gathering. Poured a murky medium-brown color with a small off-white head. Aroma was notes of light citrus with a touch of sour notes. Flavor was light tart notes, some light citrus. Pretty refreshing.
750ml bottle pours a clear orange with no head. Nose has passion fruit, orange, a little spice, muscat grapes. Flavor has a peppery bite, spice, orange, some grape, light herbs. Tart finish.
From a bottle at the Nov 2015 RateBeer gathering. Pours a cloudy light tan. Vinours nose. Falvors of tart white grapes.

Bottle at the DC Gathering. Murky brownish yellow with minimal off-white head. Aromas of stone fruit, tart citrus. Tastes of big tart grapefruit, stone fruit, tart acidic notes, lemons. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
75ml body, thanks noodleuser. Aroma is moderately sweet, bread, lacto, some caramel, light sour. Taste is moderately sweet, lacto, light bread. Medium body, some acidity, low carbonation, stickiness.
Bottle. Clear golden amber color, off white edge head. Aroma of white wine, vanilla. Taste is sweet fruity vanilla and caramel. OK.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange, small beige head, dissipates quickly some lacing. Aroma is oak, vinous, a bit of funkiness, lemon. Flavor is quite tart actually, lemony oak, very light funk. Light body, low carbonation, refreshing.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow pour almost no head to speak of. Aroma is very vinous, with oak and white wine undertones. Tate is white wine, oak, salt, and citrus, finish is tart. Light carbonatioin, mediumi mouthfeel. Pretty tasty, quite sour at this point so drink now if youve got one!

bottle shared by tom10101, thanks bro! pours hazy/cloudy medium dark golden with a small white cap, some retention and lacing. lemongrass, fragrant plants and herbs, plastic, passionfruit, powdery candies - light to medium acidity - citric forward, bitter herbs, smooth oak - white wine-ish. light carbonation, light body, firmly tart if not puckering citric-herbal finish. o-k.

Pours a hazy golden with a medium white head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of herbs and brett. Taste is of apricots and really sour. Flavors are mostly fruity but there is that slight dill/vegetal angle that is discording. Body is light toe medium, carbonation moderate and all that acidity is really refreshing. Overall it was OK but a bit rough.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy dark golden with low white head. Minimal lacing. Aroma is of vinegar, rubber, fruits. Taste is of sourness, cheese, acidity, fruits. Palate: Light-medium body. Soft carbonation. Overall: Good, but weird. Quite sour. Not much to see here. And there is that rubber...

Bottle (750 ml) @ De Garde++ tasting. 

Appearance: Hazy orange with a small white head and little lacing. 

Aroma: Citrus, burnt tire, vinegar notes, oak, lactic notes and grapes.

Taste: Quite sour and vinegary with lemon, burnt tire, lactic notes and oak.

Palate: Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Dry. Puckering finish.

Overall: The chardonnay isnt much present. Unbalanced sour with an unpleasant acetic turn. Disappointing.

Bottle 750ml. @ [ Pre-Borefts Ratebeer Gathering ] @ ABCBeers, Korte Koediefstraat 5, The Hague, Netherlands 2511CE. [ As De Garde Fleur Desay ].Unclear - hazy matt medium amber yellow color with a average to large, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, apricot, moderate to heavy yeasty, yeast, citrus, grape - white wine. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate acidic with a long duration, sharp, apricot, grape - wine, tart. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20140925]

Bottle shared at pre-BBF14 tating at ABC Beers, Den Haag. Pours hazt light yellow with a wheat yellow hue. Quite floral nose with some citrus as well. Light sour body with quite some tannins in the back as well.
Poured a murky light amber with a small off white ring. Aroma of sour, salty urine. Light body, flavour is salty sour, quite refreshing.

bottle shared @ Pre Borefts tasting
No head or carbonation. Cloudy blond pour. Sour aftertaste.

Bottle shared at the Pre-Borefts Tasting. Pours cloudy golden brown with a ring off white head. Aroma of citrus, white wine, pungent grapes, light wood. Flavour is moderate acidic. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

Poured from bottle to glass. Hazy orange hue with fizzy white head that dissipated to a ring. Aroma is lactic, cherry, straw, sulphur, straw. Mouthfeel is great with a medium light body and zesty carbonation. Taste is dry sweetness followed by a tart sourness throughout the finish. Overall this brew is nothing short of amazing!
Bottle thanks to Chow. Pours a cloudy orange with small off white head that lasts. The aroma is strong wood, citrus, funk. Medium mouthfeel with light wood, tart citrus, easy to drink, very good.
pours a hazy amber with no head. Aroma of vinegar, sour wheat, citrus. Taste is acidic, white wine, oak and sour wheat. fruity and floral notes.

> Unblended lambic type of citric sour with underripe nectarine and leathery palate
[ Bottle ][ 75cl ][ brainlair ][ Trade ][ Reidel Reisling Glass ][ 8.12.14 ]
>> Lower carbonation, hazy deep orange pour, wispy lacing. Nose is muted, apple cider vinegar, flowers, underripe green peach, some apple oxidation. Taste is extremely sour, mega citric, spicy almost, some apple cider vinegar. Big prickly bubbles. Not bad. Muted buttery oak. Super sour underripe green nectarine, leathery fruit skin. Palate is super leathery, hugely lactic, mildly salty. Green peach juice, highly acidic. On the verge of lacerating on the citric acid scale. Still, very good- and much more akin to an unblended lambic than saison or gruit. Not much spice or adjunct character, would never peg it as a gruit.
>!< highly citric, a bit over the top

Thanks to Jeremy! Tasting glass form 750? ml. bottle. Hay murky orange with no head. Nose is sadly a bit reminiscent of vomit with rotting peaches, lactic, strong sourness, oak. Taste is far nice luckily ripe to overripe peaches, lactic, oak, lemon, quite sour, vinegar, dried apricots, wood, sour, funk, lactic, Thicker, lower carbonation. Flawed but still very nice & very unique concept, neat. De Garde really seems to like flirt with disaster & take real risks, admirable considering that they do make some pretty nice beers.

Bottle 
Pours dark murky amber no foam 
smell is oak , bit wine , funk . 
taste is sour , full , sharp , wood , dry . Very nice !

Aroma: Brett, Chardonnay, Flowers

Appearance: Hazy Orangish Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Chardonnay, Grassy, Floral, Brett

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying, Mild Tart

Bottle shared by Doug 
Hazy orange with a small white head and some lacing. Aroma is very acidic, floral, ripe fruit and cheese. Taste is acidic, throw up, woody and lemon 
Good, very harsh and sour

On tap at the 1st anniversary - First beer at the event and it was a winner. Pours murky orange with a huge off-white head. The aroma has sweet tarts, bugs and berries. It has a medium grainy body with soft carbonation. The flavor starts off with sweet tarts, lots of wild ale funk and citric sourness. The finish has a barnyard aspect, a touch of barrel and a lactic bite. Great beer.

Bomber from the Anniversary event. Pours a cloudy copper color with a small white head. A massive fruity and funky nose, oak. Really sharp flavors, sawdust, tannins, lemons, bitter, very sour, pushing towards acidic, Good beer. Very fruity, very sour, loads of oak.
Bottle shared by Bobby for 7,300th rating. Pours cloudy yellow gold with white head. Nose/taste of chardonnay, white wine, oak, grapefruit and citrus. Sour fruits. Medium body.
Bottle thanks bobby. Hazy golden amber pour with white lacing. Apricot and fresh fruit aromas, with nice tart funk. Wow, tart start and finish; oak wine, funky apricot flavors.

Bottle from brewery, Eugene. Pours a rich golden pink, akin to grapefruit juice decent amount of fast dissipating head. Aroma lovely, grapes subtle with a latent lacto character too, just a tinge of citrus and grass as well. Very tart, juicy, finish.
